results.title: Simvastatin acutely reduces ischemic brain damage in the immature rat via Akt and CREB activation.
results.text_hl: Neonatal @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were subjected to @DISEASE_Arterial_Occlusive_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001157 @@@occlusion of the@@@ right carotid @DISEASE_Renal_Artery_Obstruction @DISEASE_MESH:D012078 @@@artery@@@ followed by 2.5 h @DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@ (@DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@hypoxia@@@-@DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Harlequin_type_ichthyosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C538424 @@@HI@@@). @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Sim@@@ was given at the dose of 10 or 5 mg/kg, s.c. from postnatal day 1 (PN1) to PN7, or at 20 mg/kg from PN4 to PN7, or at 20 mg/kg in a single administration 18 h before the onset of the @DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ procedure.

citations.NLM: Carloni S, Girelli S, Buonocore G, Longini M, Balduini W. Simvastatin acutely reduces ischemic brain damage in the immature rat via Akt and CREB activation. Exp Neurol. 2009 Nov;220(1):82-9. PMID: 19664625
